business.headline: Hindustan Zinc share price falls 3% after hitting 16-month high. What's next?The stock moved lower later in the session after a strong rally seen over the past few weeks and was trading at Rs 622.80, down 2.21% as of 1:41 PM.

Why withdrawing EPF during a job switch can be a costly financial mistakeFor many salaried Indians, a job switch is exciting but also financially unsettling. Between rent deposits, moving costs and lifestyle adjustments, the temptation to dip into accumulated EPF savings is very real.

Is there any penalty if you file a revised ITR before December 31 deadline?Found an error in your tax return and unsure what to do next? Is there any penalty if you correct it by filing a revised ITR before December 31?

Timex Group shares crash over 10% today. Know why it's fallingAt around 12 pm, shares of Timex Group India were trading at Rs 316.60 on the BSE, down 9.99%. During the day, the stock touched an intra-day low of Rs 318 per share.

Gold prices at record highs: What's driving the rally and what comes next?Gold's rally is not being driven by a single factor. Instead, multiple supportive forces are acting together. Here's all you need to know.

PAN–Aadhaar not linked yet? What happens if you miss December 31 deadlineIf your PAN is still not linked with Aadhaar, the clock is ticking. The Income Tax Department has set December 31, 2025 as the final deadline, and missing it could make your PAN inoperative, affecting tax filing and refunds.

Silver breaches Rs 2.5 lakh per kg for 1st time: Why waiting may be wiserThe sharp rise has put silver firmly in the spotlight, forcing investors to confront a familiar question at uncomfortable levels: is it still worth buying, or is patience the better strategy now?

Why experience-led design is becoming a core growth driver for hotelsToday, aesthetics, technology, sustainability, and emotional engagement intersect to shape both guest satisfaction and commercial growth.

IRFC share price down over 4% after recent rally: Why is it falling today?Shares of Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC) fell as much as 4.64% during the day to Rs 127.44 on the BSE. Rail Vikas Nigam Ltd declined up to 3.84% to Rs 373.05.
Hindustan Copper share price jumps over 11%: What's driving the rally?The Hindustan Copper stock was trading at Rs 528.55, up 11.13%, at around 11:24 am on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Silver prices at record high: Should you buy now or wait for correction?The takeaway from experts is fairly clear. Silver's long-term outlook remains strong, supported by rising industrial demand, tight supply, and its dual role as a precious and industrial metal.
Sensex, Nifty open marginally higher amid lack of fresh triggersThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 18.79 points to 85,060.24, while the NSE Nifty50 added 11.90 points to 26,054.20 as of 9:23 am.

Silver at record highs: Why prices are surging and should you buy now?Market experts say silver's sharp rise is being driven by a powerful combination of factors rather than a single trigger. Here is all you need to know.

This Indian-origin CEO is now richer than Satya Nadella and Sundar PichaiAccording to Hurun India's latest list for 2025, Jayshree Ullal, President and CEO of Arista Networks, has taken the top spot among Indian-origin leaders globally.

Who files belated ITRs most often? Salaried employees, freelancers or gig workersWho ends up filing belated ITRs most often; salaried employees, freelancers or gig workers? While the Income-tax Department does not release category-wise data, expert observations reveal surprising trends behind delayed filings.

Inside the tax refund limbo: The bigger story behind the 'put on hold' alertsThousands of tax refunds were suddenly put on hold and the message gave no reasons, no timelines. What is really going on inside the income tax system, and why are even honest taxpayers being flagged?

More jobs, higher incomes: New Zealand PM Luxon hails India free trade agreementIndia and New Zealand have successfully concluded a comprehensive Free Trade Agreement, marking a significant milestone in bilateral relations.

Defence personnel get specialised home loan options. Details hereAs competition rises and metro demand cools, housing finance firms are recalibrating strategies, betting on defence families as low-risk, long-term borrowers who need customised loans rather than generic salaried products.

PAN–Aadhaar not linked after December 31? Be ready for penalty and ITR issuesThe December 31 PAN–Aadhaar linking deadline is crucial for taxpayers, as missing it may lead to penalties, ITR filing restrictions, refund delays and higher tax deductions at source.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as year-end rally fizzlesThe BSE Sensex closed at 85,041.45, down 367.25 points or 0.43%, while the NSE Nifty50 settled at 26,042.30, lower by 99.80 points. The session remained volatile, with markets slipping after early stability as investors turned cautious at higher levels.

entertainment.headline: Salman Khan shares gratitude to fans who wished him on his birthday: Means a lot Salman Khan thanked his fans and well-wishers for sending warm greetings on his 60th birthday. He will next be seen in Apoorva Lakhia's 'Battle of Galwan' (2026).

Chaithra Achar to star in Shaktiprasad's emotional thriller Laila's Sweet Dream Actor Chaithra J Achar is starring in Laila's Sweet Dream, a Kannada film directed by first-time feature filmmaker Shaktiprasad. The production explores the emotional nuances of mother-daughter relationships.

Prabhas' Spirit: First look set for New Year's Eve reveal, says report  As fans await updates on The Raja Saab, reports suggest that the first-look poster of Prabhas from spirit could drop on New Year's Eve.

Miley Cyrus reveals how Oscars 2025 led to new film music projects At the 2025 Oscars, Miley Cyrus actively networked with directors and producers, offering to write original music for upcoming film and television projects.

Please stick to me only: Malti Chahar slams parents being dragged into interviews Bigg Boss 19 contestant Malti Chahar has criticised media outlets and interviewers for repeatedly mentioning her parents in interviews, requesting respect for her family's privacy.

Gwyneth Paltrow admits nepo baby privilege landed her role in Spielberg's Hook Gwyneth Paltrow admitted that the privilege of being a "nepo baby" in Hollywood landed her role in Steven Spielberg's 'Hook'. The actor features in the sports comedy-drama 'Marty Supreme', opposite Timothee Chalamet.

Was about to say no: Arshad Warsi had apprehensions about his role in Munna BhaI Actor Arshad Warsi recently revealed that he wanted to reject Circuit's role in 'Munna Bhai M.B.B.S'. In a recent interview, Arshad said that he was on the verge of saying no to the film initially.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: Suraj-Malu evicted in surprise double elimination Suraj Singh and Maalu Nipanal were evicted in the weekend episodes of Bigg Boss Kannada 12 in a different format, following the absence of host Kichcha Sudeep.

BTS' label takes legal action over stalking, AI abuse targeting the group BigHit Music has launched fresh legal proceedings against individuals spreading malicious content about BTS. The move highlights a zero-tolerance policy amid rising stalking and misinformation concerns as BTS plans a comeback.

BTS Suga returns to Weverse after 2 years, introduces pet cat Tang Suga's heartfelt return to social media after completing his military service has sent the BTS ARMY into an emotional frenzy across his fandom. He went live on WeVerse on Sunday and introduced his cat to the ARMY.

SRK smiles and records son AbRam's annual day performance in viral video. Watch Shah Rukh Khan's video enjoying son AbRam's annual day performance has emerged online. The superstar was seen cheering for his son and recording his act in the viral clip.

Kriti Kharbanda warns fans about WhatsApp scamster posing as her Actor Kriti Kharbanda has issued a warning to fans after discovering an unknown individual impersonating her on WhatsApp, urging vigilance as similar incidents impact other celebrities.

Varun Dhawan grieves the loss of his pet dog in emotional post: RIP Angel Varun Dhawan grieved the death of his pet dog Angel in an emotional post. He shared throwback pictures with Angel, also featuring his wife, Natasha Dalal.

Imran Khan calls Matru Ki Bijlee Ka Mandola his loneliest film Imran Khan shares insights into his casting in Matru Ki Bijlee Ka Mandola, expressing concerns about the motivations behind Bollywood casting decisions and his personal experience working with director Vishal Bhardwaj.

Saumya Tandon praises Aditya Dhar's bold cinematic vision Saumya Tandon reflected on her role in Dhurandhar and praises director Aditya Dhar for reshaping Bollywood's casting approach. The film became the first Bollywood movie to cross Rs 700 crore at the box office.

K-pop group Billlie on musical growth, India, learning from IU, SHINee K-pop girl band Billlie discusses their musical growth and evolving sound in an exclusive interview. The group highlights their collaboration with IU and growing bond with Indian fans.

Smile is courage: Tehseen Poonawalla to Salman trolls over Battle of Galwan teaser Tehseen Poonawalla responded to online criticism of Salman Khan's brief smile in the teaser for Battle of Galwan. He argued that the expression reflects composure and psychological strength rather than levity.

Didn't care about Sivaji's moral barkings: RGV's support post for Niddhi Agerwal Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma has criticised actor Sivaji following Sivaji's controversial statements about women's clothing at a recent film event, sparking discourse about misogyny and freedom of expression within the Telugu film industry.

King, Ramayana to Toxic: Most anticipated films of 2026 Indian cinema in 2026 returns with big-budget sequels and mythological epics like King, Ramayana and Toxic. The year marks a renewed focus on scale, stars, and legacy franchises that aim for theatrical spectacle.

general news.headline: Supreme Court pauses rape convict Kuldeep Sengar's bail: He won't be releasedThe Supreme Court flagged serious questions of law while examining the bail granted to Kuldeep Singh Sengar, the convict in the Unnao rape case. It stressed that the ex-MLA couldn't walk free as he was already serving jail term in a separate criminal case.

Top court pauses own order on definition of Aravalli Hills, sets up review panelThe Supreme Court said that the environmental impact of recommendations made by an earlier panel on the Aravalli range must be examined by a committee of experts, noting that the previous panel was largely composed of bureaucrats.

Two Telangana women, on job hunt in US, killed in road accidentThe victims were identified as Pullakhandam Meghana Rani and Kadiyala Bhavana, both aged 24. The two women were originally from Garla Mandal, Mahabubabad district.

Could've stayed in Mumbai: US influencer shocks with post on Canada hospital deathA US attorney triggered outrage with insensitive remarks on the death of an Indian-origin man in a hospital in Canada, which led to social media users calling him out in the comments section.
Aravalli formed 2.5 billion years ago, could vanish by 2059One of the world's oldest mountain systems that formed over 2.5 billion years ago, the Aravalli range, is on course to likely go extinct.

Lalit Modi apologises for 'biggest fugitives' video: Respect Indian governmentWhile Mallya is wanted in India on fraud and laundering charges in connection with loans he took for the now-defunct Kingfisher Airlines, Modi is facing charges of financial misconduct and irregularities during the early years of IPL, when he was the chairperson of the league.

Unnao rape case: Court slams social media trial, taking legal battles to streetA bench headed by Chief Justice of India (CJI) Surya Kant, while hearing a plea filed by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) challenging the High Court order suspending Sengar's life sentence in the rape case, observed that attempts are being made to take political advantage of the situation, warning them against public browbeating of judiciary.

Delhi school teachers in Delhi deployed for citywide stray dog countThe Delhi government has assigned school teachers to assist in a citywide exercise to count stray dogs as part of a public safety initiative. The move, ordered by the Directorate of Education, applies to teachers from both government and private schools across the capital.

Dhurandhar ka baap? China's Ne Zha 2 grosses $2.2 billion, is 2025's biggest hitThe biggest global hit of 2025 is Ne Zha 2, the Chinese animated film made on a budget LA studios would deem paltry. However, its screen count and collections bare the disparity between Indian and Chinese film trade.

Live: Tarique Rahman files nomination, to contest Bangladesh polls from 2 seatsIndia on Sunday rejected Bangladesh Police's claim that two prime suspects in the murder of Inqilab Moncho founder Osman Hadi had fled into Meghalaya after crossing the Haluaghat border in Mymensingh. The Border Security Force said there was no confirmation of the accused entering Indian territory, countering the assertion made by Dhaka Metropolitan Police, Prothom Alo reported. Earlier, DMP Additional Commissioner SN Nazrul Islam had told reporters that the suspects escaped to India with the help of local associates. The development came amid escalating unrest in Bangladesh, with Inqilab Moncho announcing nationwide blockades across all divisional cities from 2 pm on Sunday, seeking justice for founder Sharif Osman Bin Hadi, whose killing earlier this month sparked widespread protests and violence. Stay tuned to Indiatoday.in for live updates.

Video: Overloaded truck nicks divider, overturns and flattens SUV; 1 killedThe driver of the Bolero was killed after a husk-laden truck overturned on it, in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur district. The Bolero had 'Uttar Pradesh Government' written on it. The tragic incident was captured on CCTV camera.

ID must for social media access: Ireland to push for EU-wide driveIreland will use its EU presidency to push for ID-verified social media accounts. This move aims to tackle anonymous abuse and protect democratic stability across Europe.

How blurry photos in France helped dig up Kashmir's 2000-year-old Buddhist pastAfter decades of curiosity and surveys, the mounds in Baramulla's Zehanpora have revealed ancient Buddhist stupas and urban-type settlements, which link Kashmir to the Gandhara Buddhist network. The discovery, made possible by old photographs at a French museum, opened a 2,000-year-old chapter with Kashmir as a central hub of Buddhist learning and monastic activity.

Hate normalised: Rahul Gandhi slams BJP over racial assault on Tripura studentCongress leader Rahul Gandhi condemned the killing of 24-year-old Tripura student Anjel Chakma in a racial attack in Dehradun as a horrific hate crime, blaming it on a prolonged atmosphere of hatred normalised by BJP.

'Wrong concealer?' Buzz over Trump's 'painted hand' at meeting with ZelenskyyPublic attention has focused on President Trump's hand, seen with visible makeup and bandages during a recent meeting with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy. The White House attributes the appearance to frequent handshaking and routine health measures, reiterating its commitment to transparency amid health speculation.

Video: Tamil Nadu boys attack migrant worker with machete, flash 'victory' signA video showing four minors brutally attacking a migrant worker in Tamil Nadu with machetes has gone viral, triggering outrage and prompting a police investigation.

He walked away from IIT dream and started an AI startup at 19A 19-year-old has traded his IIT dream to launch a startup. He first raised USD 3 million in seed funding for his AI venture, Supermemory, and then built a tool that quickly drew attention.

Someone wants to marry my husband: Pakistan cricketer's wife explains divorceSannia Ashfaq has revealed the reason for her divorce from former Pakistan cricketer Imad Wasim, citing third-party involvement. Imad and Sannia were married in August 2019 in Islamabad.

Congress vs Congress? Revanth Reddy counters Digvijaya Singh with Sonia praiseA day after Congress leader Digvijaya Singh praised the organisational strength of the RSS and the BJP, Telangana CM Revanth Reddy stepped into the row, invoking Sonia Gandhi's leadership to cite how people from the political periphery rose to become prime ministers. The back-to-back posts by the Congress leaders have been perceived by some as infighting.

80 drones in 36 hours: Pak admits Indian strikes on Nur Khan base during Op SindoorIshaq Dar's remarks marked a notable shift from Pakistan's earlier position, which had largely denied or played down the extent of damage caused by Indian strikes.

Dhurandhar storms past Rs 1,050 crore globally, becomes 7th biggest Indian filmDhurandhar box office Day 24: Ranveer Singh's spy thriller earned Rs 1064 crore worldwide, surpassing Pathaan and Kalki 2898 AD. The film also became the 7th-highest-grossing Indian film in history.

Tripura student killed in racial attack suffered right-side paralysis: Case reportGraphic Era Hospital report revealed that Angel Chakma suffered severe head, back, and spinal injuries. After 17 days of treatment, the Tripura student succumbed, prompting murder charges.

Parivar together: Ajit Pawar announces alliance with uncle Sharad for local pollsMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar declared that his NCP and Sharad Pawar's NCP (SP) will jointly contest the upcoming Pimpri-Chinchwad municipal elections, marking a significant reunion of the Pawar family factions ahead of the January 15 vote.

Dense fog blankets Delhi-NCR, 128 flights cancelled, schools shut in NoidaThe India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert of very dense fog for Delhi, with maximum and minimum temperatures likely to hover around 22 and 7 degrees Celsius, respectively. Parts of Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand are also under the orange alert.

sports.headline: Ashes: ICC gives Melbourne pitch for Boxing Day Test second-worst rating The Melbourne Cricket Ground pitch used for the fourth Ashes Test has received an "Unsatisfactory" rating, resulting in one demerit point for the venue under the ICC Pitch and Outfield Monitoring Process.

Dhruv Jurel slams 101-ball 160 in Vijay Hazare Trophy ahead of New Zealand ODIs Dhruv Jurel smashed an unbeaten 160* off 101 balls to help Uttar Pradesh score 369 against Baroda in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. It was the third successive fifty-plus score for the youngster in the tournament.

Mitchell Starc backed to defy history, play Ashes and World Cup in 2027 Mitchell Starc's durability is reshaping expectations around fast-bowling longevity. With another dominant Ashes summer behind him, Australia believe the left-armer could still be leading attacks at the 2027 Ashes and World Cup.

Shubman Gill can't be an all-format captain: Ex-cricketer slams Kohli comparisons Former England spinner Monty Panesar has dismissed Shubman Gill as an all-format captain, saying the young batter does not yet possess the intensity required for the role.

Someone wants to marry my husband: Pakistan cricketer's wife explains divorce Sannia Ashfaq has revealed the reason for her divorce from former Pakistan cricketer Imad Wasim, citing third-party involvement. Imad and Sannia were married in August 2019 in Islamabad.

T20 World Cup 2026: Australia set to make key Pat Cummins call despite injury Australia remain confident Pat Cummins, Josh Hazlewood and Tim David will be fit for the T20 World Cup. Despite injury concerns, selectors are set to include the trio in their provisional squad.

IND vs NZ: Special tickets for students, specially-abled fans in Indore ODI Tickets for the India-New Zealand final ODI, scheduled to be played in Indore on January 18, will be sold exclusively online. The Madhay Pradesh Cricket Assocition has announced special concessions for students and specially-abled fans, enhancing accessibility.

Joe Root backs Brendon McCullum, Ben Stokes to continue despite Ashes loss Joe Root has expressed strong support for Ben Stokes and Brendon McCullum-led team management despite England's Ashes series loss in Australia. England are trailing by 1-3 in the ongoing series with one match remaining.

ISL future in flux as Odisha FC weigh exit, Jamshedpur commit to revised season The Indian Super League faces fresh uncertainty as clubs debate costs and format. Jamshedpur FC have committed to the revised season, while Odisha FC may opt out unless financial clarity and commercial backing emerge.

Sunil Gavaskar questions ICC's double standards: MCG pitch will be rated 'good' Sunil Gavaskar has criticised the ICC for double standards in awarding pitch ratings after the Melbourne Test ended in two days. A total of 36 wickets fell within two days as the entire Test match was completed within 142 overs.

Gus Atkinson ruled out of Sydney Test, England to not name any replacement England fast bowler Gus Atkinson has been ruled out of the final Ashes Test in Sydney after sustaining a hamstring injury. The fifth Ashes Test is set to be played in Sydney beginning on January 4.

Ashes: Australia selectors to decide Khawaja Test future as no retirement word yetUsman Khawaja's Test future remains uncertain despite growing retirement speculation. With no word yet from the veteran batter, Australian selectors are prepared to independently assess his place beyond the Sydney Ashes Test.

John Cena's farewell chaos, a Rocky dilemma: Why 2025 wasn't WWE's finest yearA year that was supposed to be a brilliant one for WWE ended being one of the frustrating ones from a creative standpoint. The company fumbled John Cena's farewell run and the absence of the Rock and the return of Brock Lesnar failed to inspire a revival for them in 2025.

Cristiano Ronaldo sets 1000-goals target clear: I will reach that number for sureCristiano Ronaldo has set his sights firmly on football's unreachable 1000-goal milestone. Fresh from Globe Soccer Awards recognition, the Al-Nassr star insists injuries aside, his scoring journey is far from finished.

India plan to rest Jasprit Bumrah, Hardik Pandya for New Zealand ODIs: ReportsIndia are set to rest Jasprit Bumrah and Hardik Pandya for the New Zealand ODI series. The move is aimed at preserving their fitness with the T20 World Cup fast approaching.

Cristiano Ronaldo, Dembele, Yamal: All the winners at Globe Soccer awardsCristiano Ronaldo and Ousmane Dembele dominated the spotlight at the Globe Soccer Awards 2025. From PSG's sweeping success to Luis Enrique's coaching honour, the night celebrated football's biggest winners in Dubai.

World Rapid C'ships: Carlsen wins sixth title, Koneru Humpy settles for bronzeMagnus Carlsen captured his sixth World Rapid Chess Championship title after a dramatic final day, while Koneru Humpy narrowly missed a record third women's crown, finishing third on tie-breaks despite sharing the top score.

SG Pipers kick off Women's Hockey India League with 2-0 win vs Ranchi RoyalsSG Pipers began their Women's Hero Hockey India League 2025–26 campaign with a convincing 2–0 win over Ranchi Royals, showing strong defensive organisation and clinical finishing. Navneet Kaur and Teresa Viana scored for the Pipers as the team controlled key phases of the match in Ranchi.

Revenge on mind, Aryna Sabalenka reflects on Battle of the Sexes loss to Nick KyrgiosWorld No.1 Aryna Sabalenka vowed to return stronger after a 3–6, 3–6 loss to Nick Kyrgios in Dubai's Battle of the Sexes exhibition, saying the clash gave her clear insight into his strengths and weaknesses ahead of a potential rematch.

Battle of Sexes: No winner found as Kyrgios trumps Sabalenka in straight setsNick Kyrgios defeated Aryna Sabalenka in the Battle of the Sexes in Dubai. The event, which had flashes of brilliance, ended up being a complete dud.

Utter nonsense: Fans slam Sabalenka vs Kyrgios Battle of sexes matchThe faceoff between Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios drew the ire of the fans online, who questioned the purpose of the contest due to the difference in court dimensions. Kyrgios went on to beat the women's World No.1 in straight sets.

After record 80 vs Sri Lanka, Smriti Mandhana admits tough transition to T20IsIND vs SL: Smriti Mandhana overcame a mentally challenging shift from ODIs to T20Is to smash 80, praise Shafali Verma, and script history with 10,000 international runs as India went 4-0 up against Sri Lanka.

Ruthless India Women pile on misery for Sri Lanka in Trivandrum, take 4-0 leadIND vs SL, 4th WT20I: India took a 4-0 lead in the five-match series with a dominant 30-run win against Sri Lanka on Sunday at the Greenfield Stadium in Trivandrum. The visitors racked up their highest Women's T20I score, but it wasn't enough for them to chase down India's massive target.

Pakistan Cricket Board takes charge of Multan Sultans after ugly Ali Tareen exitThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has taken temporary control of Multan Sultans ahead of Pakistan Super League 2026 after a dispute with former owner Ali Khan Tareen.

Battle of the Sexes Highlights: Kyrgios beats Sabalenka in straight setsBattle of the Sexes Highlights, Aryna Sabalenka vs Nick Kyrgios: Aryna Sabalenka loses to Nick Kyrgios in straight sets in the Battle of the Sexes. Kyrgios beats Sabalenka 6-3, 6-3 and clinches the exhibition match in Dubai.

Shreyas Iyer set for ODI return, expected to play Vijay Hazare as well: ReportStar India batter Shreyas Iyer might make his return in the ODI series against New Zealand. Iyer has been out of action after copping a nasty spleen injury in India's 3-match series against Australia in October.

Former England cricketer and Cricket Board chief, Hugh Morris dies aged 62Hugh Morris, respected for his integrity and service to cricket as both a player and administrator, has passed away at 62 after a battle with cancer. Tributes from across the cricketing world recognise his impact on and off the field.

Mandhana joins Mithali Raj in elite list, gets to 10,000 international runsSmriti Mandhana joined an elite list of stars as she became the fourth batter in women's cricket to get to 10,000 international runs on Sunday, December 28.

If India don't want to shake hands, Pakistan have no desire either: Mohsin NaqviAt a press conference in Lahore on Sunday, PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi said Pakistan have no desire to shake hands with the Indian team if the gesture is not reciprocated. The two sides have not exchanged handshakes since the Men's Asia Cup in September earlier this year.

IND vs SL: Jemimah Rodrigues out of 4th T20I as India make 2 changesIndia will be without the services of Jemimah Rodrigues for the 4th Women's T20I against Sri Lanka as the batter misses out due to illness. India make two changes for the match with the series wrapped up.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
